data.description:
Do you play tennis? Now you can keep track of the score in your Pebble!

Tennis Score for Pebble tracks points, games, sets and who is serving. Update the score by pressing a button; undo available. Choose between best of 3 or 5 sets; tiebreak for all sets. Shows current time and match duration.

Features: 

+ Menu:
	- Select best of 3 or best of 5 sets
	- Select who starts serving
	- Start match!

+ Match: 
Use buttons to track the score.
	- Up: point to your opponent
	- Down: point to you
	- Select: undo last point; as many times as you want
	- Back: exit to main menu

+ Score:
	- Upper row: your opponent score
	- Lower row: your score
	- Left time: current time
	- Right time: match duration in minutes
	- Asterisk: who is serving

+Statistics:
Scroll down at the end of the match.
	- Match score
	- Number of points won
	- Match and set duration

Give it a <3 if you like it! Thank you!

data.description:
Meet Mr. Baseball Guy, the baseball score viewer for your Pebble. Features include:

* (New feature) You can now add your favorite teams to your Timeline! If you choose to do this, you will also receive an alert when the game starts and a notification when it ends. Powered by Raspberry Pi.

* View all the current game's plays by holding the up button. Batteries not included.

* Automatic and manual refresh (hold select), so you can vigorously watch your game's score as you vigorously ignore class and work.

* A date selector, so you can go back to a time when your team was actually relevant.

* A color display (Time devices only).

* Up to 3 favorite teams, so you can watch your team win. Or, if you're a fan of my team, see a daily reminder of how much the other team can score.

* Matchup and game details, as well as the last play -- more plays coming*.

* The option to vibrate on score change.

* A clock (patent pending).

*More features are coming soon, like Timeline support, more plays, and possibly in-game box scores.

This is the initial release, so there are still probably some bugs. Just let me know when you find one!
See what our best users (read: me) have to say:

"Genuinely good."
-- Ethan B.

"A real heartwarming love story."
-- E. Bogart

"Don't knock it 'till you try it. Ok, I guess I didn't really like it that much."
-- E. B. Fakelastname

"Someone always puts my name on these things. I didn't say that. I never said that."
-- Robert

latest_release.release_notes: Add playoff games to your Timeline! October baseball is too exciting to pass up!

data.description:
Estimate the time it will take to charge your Electric Vehicle (EV) and get notification when it is to be charge complete. 

The estimate is based upon knowing/setting the vehicle battery size and the vehicle initial SOC (State Of Charge) when you start charging. Estimates are made for Level 1 ( L1 @ 1.4 kW) and Level 2 (L2 @ 3kW & 6kW) capacity chargers. You can exit> the application after you advance through the screens and you will be notified with vibration at the time when L1 or L2 is at 100%. You can reset> if you want to cancel this reminder or start with a new charge cycle estimate. For these estimates to be accurate you will need to know and configure your initial battery capacity and set the initial SOC when you start your charging cycle.

data.description:
2 Steps RPG is a role playing game in which the kingdom is under threat, and you've been asked to investigate the source of the threat and confront it.

As you venture further from your home, the enemies you confront will become more challenging. Although you'll start weak at first, soon you'll grow much more powerful and able to travel much further from home. Many times you'll find yourself going two steps forward then make one step back to safety.

The user interface was specifically designed for the Pebble. You travel forward (to the danger) or back (to safety). The game automatically saves when you exit and automatically loads when you open it to continue right where you left off. The select button handles a variety of location specific actions.

Once you've won, try again to see if you can do it in fewer moves. Or for a bigger challenge, try focusing on training attack or defense or neither!

Please join us on the Pebble Discussion Board for feedback and feature requests. Good luck!

latest_release.release_notes: - Made change such that "fight" automatically repeats attacks until at least you or the enemy receives damage.

data.description:
Football timer designed for the NGFFL flag football league based on an original design by Sheldon Smith. 

Features include:

 -- 30 second play clock with vibrations at 15, 10, 5, and 0 seconds. (Pressing up button starts clock or stops it and resets it to 30 if it is already running.)

 -- 30 minute game clock with vibration at 2 and 0 minutes.

 -- Game clock status indicator - Changes color and message to show whether clock is stopped or running at a glance.

 -- Quick-Edit mode (long-press the down button) to quickly add or subtract time.

 -- Time of Day visible at top of screen.

 -- Persistent memory: App will be aware of the game and play clock state if the app is exited (although vibrations will not occur) and will pick up with the correct time remaining when the app is restarted. 

Features Planned but Not Yet Implemented:
 -- Menu to access the following features:
 -- -- Reset the game clock without having to wait for it to wind down or having to use the Quick-Edit mode.
 -- -- Set default starting values for the Play and Game Clocks other than 30 seconds/minutes respectively.
 -- -- Option to hide certain elements for a less cluttered screen.
 -- -- Option to disable the two-minute warning.

latest_release.release_notes: v0.1 First release - Features are still to be added to make it more useful for other types of U.S. football leagues but fully functional for running a NGFFL game.

data.description:
Pickle Pal is the score keeper especially designed for Pickleball. 

- Easily tracks score, server position and number (1/2) 
- Works for both regulation and rally scoring 
- Simple and easy to view display
- Simple interface with error correction

Display Layout:
- Layout matches court
- Opponents score is always on top
- Your teams score is always on bottom
- Serving team is highlighted in white
- Current server (1 or 2) and position is indicated at the corners of the display

To Start Pickle Pal Application:
- Click [Select] button  
- Click [Down] button until Pickle Pal application is highlighted
- Click [Select] button

Button Quick Reference:
- Double click [BACK] button - Starts a new game
- [Select] button - Toggles the starting server position between your team and opponent's team (at start of new game only)
- [UP] button - Increments score when your opponent wins the rally 
- [DOWN] button - Increments score when your teams wins the rally
- Holding the [UP] button - Decrements your opponent's score 
- Holding the [DOWN] button - Decrements your team's score
- [SELECT] button - Changes the server position
- Holding the [SELECT] - Changes the server number (1/2)
- [BACK] button - Exit game or exit setting menu (with confirm)

latest_release.release_notes: - Added confirmation screen to prevent accidental exit

data.title: Pickle Pal

changelog.release_notes: Hotfix data source

/!\ Help needed! I've got a lot of requests for pebble classic and pebble time round versions, but I don't have the time. If anyone has any pebble.js skills, consider contributing to https://github.com/tetrapus/PoGoPebble

What's new:
- Night mode (Enable Backlight) in the settings menu enables the backlight when you lock onto a Pokemon. Best for night time pokemon hunting!
- Add a new setting to temporarily disable priority settings, for when you just want to catch 'em all.
- Infinite scroll lets you scroll past the end of the nearby list. Proper scrolling animations coming soon.

Fixes:
- Vibrate when the active pokemon enters the alert range, not just on first appearance
- Fix search bar so it isn't terrible
- Fix undefined settings before first config

Optimisations:
- Optimised more pokemon sprites
Fix duplicate pokemon bug

First release of the WatchApp version of PoGoPebble! The watchapp is identical to the watchface (PokeWatch), but gives you more control over navigating through nearby pokemon.

   - Press the middle button to lock a pokemon in place
   - Hold the middle button to dismiss a pokemon. You can reset dismissed pokemon by reloading the app.
   - Press the up and down arrows to navigate through the list of nearby pokemon. Navigating will automatically lock the selected pokemon.
   - Hold the up and down arrows to increase or decrease the priority of the current pokemon.
   - Shake the watchface to toggle between pokemon location, pokemon name, and current date and time.

data.description:
Hunt down nearby Pokemon!

See directions to Pokemon around you, get notified when new ones pop up, and represent your team!

Check out the settings page to customise your team and change your notification & filter settings.

In the app, use the up and down buttons to scroll through pokemon, and the select button to pin and unpin. Hold select to dismiss a Pokemon, and hold up and down to change the priority.

Shake your wrist to toggle between pokemon location, name, and current time.

If no pokemon are nearby matching your filters, will show your team colours. Check out PokeWatch for the watchface version of this app, sans scrolling.

PTR/OG Pebble support coming soon. See https://github.com/tetrapus/PoGoPebble/releases for pre-release builds for those platforms.

Suggestions, patches and bug reports very welcome!
data.title: PokeHunt

data.description:
Pokemon Go, Pokemon finder, locate Pokemon close to you without the Pokemon Go app.

31/7/16 - Servers Down, Working on Fix!

Have a feature request, please contact me!

Love my app? Please donate: http://bit.ly/2awtWST

How does it work?
Simply leave the Pebble application running and when you are within 35 meters (or notification distance set in settings) of a Pokemon your Pebble will vibrate and display the nearby Pokemon information. If no Pokemon are within the notification distance a list of Pokemon nearby will be displayed.

Q. Searching... is displayed with no nearby Pokemon?
A. Servers could be overloaded, or you are in an area with no nearby Pokemon.

Q. Do I need to run the Pokemon Go application on my phone at the same time?
A. No, the Pebble application works independently of the Pokemon Go application on your phone.

== TODO/IMPROVEMENTS ==
1. Additional language programming for full multi language capability.

Not affiliated with Niantic or Nintendo. All trademarks property of their respective owners.

latest_release.release_notes: V1.3 - Layout change, duplicate Pokemon nearby bug fixed, Pokedex languages added (next release to include full language support), options enhanced to allow selection of scan and notification distance, option added to "hunt" particular Pokemon, Pokemon images added, Backlight bug fixed.

data.description:
A simple dice rolling app.

Use the top button to cycle through the number of sides on the dice - 2, 3, 4, 6, 8, 10, or 20. 

Use the bottom button to cycle through the number of dice. 1 - 6. 

The center button, or a flick or the wrist, will roll the dice.

The total and current dice selection in 'xdy' terms are at the bottom.

The colors are random, as everyone knows that good design comes from random colors.

All dice will have the same number of sides, making this app not as useful as it could be. But it does what I need out of a dice roller, which isn't much.  I'm not much of a programmer, but this was a fun project. I hope it helps.
data.title: Dice Roller

data.description:
The ultimate Pebble sailing app! Displays your realtime speed and heading, along with wind speed and direction on a compass dial.

Other screens include the current weather conditions, weather forecast, tide information, a zoomable map, and a sailing timer. You can switch screens using a long press to the up or down buttons. The select button on the Pebble activates the screens and settings menu.

Speed and bearing is calculated using the smart phone GPS. Use the up and down buttons to zoom the map. The menu has a button for refreshing weather (or the map if it is visible).

Select from several different weather services, including OpenWeatherMap.org, Yahoo Weather, NOAA, and the commercial service Forecast.io for premium subscribers. If tide is activated, the nearest NOAA or Canadian station is used to display tide information. GPS is used to find the closest weather station unless a manual location is entered.

Customizable settings include the speed units (knots, mps, mph, kph), temperature scale, air pressure, date format, battery, connection, vibration alert, backlight, and more. SetPebble subscribers have access to Forecast.io weather information and more-frequent updates.

Mapping tiles Copyright and courtesy of OpenStreetMap, OpenStreetMap contributors, Google Maps, ESRI ArcGIS, Stamen, and NOAA. Stamen data by Stamen Design (http://stamen.com); OpenStreetMap (http://openstreetmap.org) mapping tiles under Creative Commons licenses.

data.description:
You can leave your phone in backpack or armband, and you can see and use Locus Map functions on your Pebble smartwatch. For example in geocaching, running, hiking, walking, cycling and other outdoor sports.

This add-on works with Locus Map Pro and Locus Map Free.
Locus - addon Pebble (v2.1+) application required for this app from Google Play.

All Pebble smartwatches are supported. (including Pebble2 and Time2)

Features:
- 9 different pages on watch
- up to 8 different data fileds in all page
- NAVIGATION
  - point / route guidance
  - turn-by-turn navigation
  - expected time to destination/next point/turn
- REAL INFROMATIONS
  - speed
  - altitude
  - slope
  - heart rate (with HR belt)
  - heart rate zones
  - compass
  - gps accuracy
  - gps alert
  - phone battery alert
- TRACK RECORDING
  - control track recording (start/pause/resume)
  - track time

  - max., min. altitude
  - energy

data.author: JeroenDG
data.description:
Count to ten and instantly win a copy of 10 Second Ninja X on Steam

Four Circle Interactive and Curve Digital unveil a brilliant new initiative which will reward anyone with a Pebble smartwatch and the ability to count to 10 with a free PC copy of 10 Second Ninja X.

There’s a catch, of course: You need to be able to count to 10 exactly, to within 100th of a second. 


10 Second Ninja X on PC and consoles distils the puzzle platformer down to its purest form. Players assume control of a highly nimble and deadly ninja, tasked with destroying an army of hostile robots using cunning, speed and lots and lots of throwing stars.

Don’t let the title seduce you too much – reaching the end of the game won’t be easy. The game’s smartly designed to ensure that each level is a puzzle in itself. With just 10 seconds (maximum) to destroy all enemies, players will need to combine brain with throwing stars in order to meet each level’s objectives, with lightning-fast reactions required to be rewarded with a perfect score.

10 Second Ninja X boasts 100 immaculately designed levels. Whilst much of the challenge comes from demonstrating the dexterity and reactions necessary to traverse each level – players with real skill will want to complete each quickly. 

It’s out now on PC, Xbox One, PlayStation 4 and Vita.
www.10second.ninja

 
Instructions: 

Shake wrist to start timer
Shake wrist to stop. 

Up button - about the game
Middle button - retrieve prize if you've won it already
Down button - further information
data.title: 10 Second Ninja X Challenge

data.description:
Cinkciarz.pl Pebble dedicated app, enables you to browse currency exchange rates quickly and comfortably. The exchange rate for the displayed currency pair is updated on demand (watchapp) or every three minutes, and the currencies change every five seconds (watchface). The apps turns to a lower activity mode between 9:00 PM and 7:00 AM. This means that the exchange rates are updated once every hour, and the displayed currency pair changes every minute. This increases the battery's life. The app is available for two platforms: Basalt (Pebble Time and Time Steel) and Chalk (Pebble Time Round).

Following features:
- Cinkciarz.pl exchange rates

No Companion App required.
data.title: Cinkciarz.pl

data.description:
Track your surfing or swimming sessions and other activities while your smartphone is out of reach. The app lists and saves up to 50 timestamps with duration of each session (the time between two timestamps). The time duration since the latest timestamp is shown at the top and is updated every second.

Simply press the select button to create a new timestamp. A long press will clear the list and start with a new timestamp.

It is a standalone watchapp and doesn't need a smartphone connection.

If you like Session Timer, please give it a heart!

Additional features are not planned – if you would like to add some, just grab the sourcecode from GitHub and feel free to reuse it. Comments for code improvements or bugfixes are always appreciated.
data.title: Session Timer

This is a simple watch app used to show you the day of year. It was initially intended to help me keep track of DoY for when I am doing field work like plant mapping.

data.description:
Wieder einmal den Bus/ die Straßenbahn verpasst? Mit dieser App weißt du, ob Laufen musst, oder dir Zeit lassen kannst.

Konfiguriere einfach deine wichtigsten Stationen und du kannst jederzeit über deine Pebble abfragen, wann dein Öffi fährt.

Du möchtest wissen, ob die Straßenbahn barrierefrei ist? Das erkennst du einfach am Kürzel BF. 

Konfiguration:
1. Linie auswählen
2. Station + Fahrtrichtung auswählen
3. Hinzufügen
4. 1-3 für alle gewünschten Stationen wiederholen
5. Die gewünschte Reihenfolge durch die Pfeile einstellen
4. Konfiguration Speichern


Alle Daten wurden von den Wiener Linien (http://www.wienerlinien.at/)  unter CCBY-Lizenz zur Verfügung gestellt. 
Datenquelle: Stadt Wien – https://data.wien.gv.at
data.title: Meine Öffis in Wien

changelog.release_notes: Version 1.0

data.description:
I was bored one day and looking through the pebble store and I realized there weren't any drawing apps with color!  So I set off to make one. Draw in color whatever you want to your heart's content! The app works best with Pebble Time watches, but will still work with Pebble and Pebble Steel with fewer color options. If there are any additional features you would like to see send suggestions to slipperyelephantstudio@gmail.com.

Controls:
Use the buttons to move the cursor around in four directions. Long pressing the center button turns the color on and off. Color starts off by default. Long press up to choose your color. Long press down to keep backlight on. Long press the back button to leave the app.

Note:
This app is made with pebble.js so a connection to a phone is required.
data.title: Color!

changelog.release_notes: v1.0 - Minor internal performance tweaks

- Fixed timezone issue on main screen (was showing UTC instead of current timezone)
- Added highest probability to the main screen / raw values screen, so you can see highest viewing probability worldwide
v0.93 - Changed API URL to match new location
v0.92 - Updated splash screen
v0.91 - Optimizations. Should load quicker now, due to some API changes on the server end.
v0.9 - Made breaking changes to API. Updated watchapp to use new format. Also uses calculated probability instead of uncalculated probability

v0.8 - Added "Sighting probability" feature. This value gives tells you your chances of seeing an aurora directly overhead. In order to know how likely you are to see one on the horizon, use the Auroras.live app or website.

v0.7 - All data (gauges, weather and three day Kp forecast) now downloaded on app load. Previously, gauges and weather were downloaded on load, then three day Kp forecast was loaded when the menu was accessed
v0.6 - Added colour to the gauges to better resemble the website and app. Also tweaked the three day forecast for better readability
v0.5 - Bugfixes for the weather (as yr.no has now migrated to met.no), also added in fancy new colour logo!

Version 0.2:

* Redesign of menus
* All times now in your local timezone instead of UTC
* Fixes for broken 3 day forecast menu
* Fixes for broken sun / moon / rise / set times
* Added in preliminary timeline support (not yet active)
Version 0.1 - Initial Release

data.description:
Auroras.live provides up to date, at a glance information for aurora hunters. If you've ever wanted to view the northern or southern lights, auroras.live can give you the information you need.

The auroras.live watch app takes this one step further and gives you this information on your wrist, showing you three day aurora forecasts on your timeline, weather for your current location updated every minute and a a probability that you'll see an aurora!

The app makes use of the timeline, so you'll receive notifications on upcoming high-Kp periods half an hour before they happen, so you have time to grab your camera and go!

If you want even more information, be sure to check out the Auroras.live apps for iOS, Android and desktop, available at : http://app.auroras.live
data.title: Auroras.live

data.description:
Dribble is a BAC estimator for your wrist, compatible with the Pebble, Pebble Time and Pebble Time Round.

DISCLAIMER:
This only estimates your BAC - Your actual BAC may vary from what is estimated.

Features include:
    - Track time since first drink
    - Estimate time to zero BAC
    - Estimate current BAC
    - Adjust time offset since first drink

Instructions for use:
    1. Enter your gender and weight
    2. Use the first and second menu items to add drinks
        - First menu item allows you to add custom drinks
        - Second menu item contains preset drinks
    3. Use the third and fourth menu items to adjust time offset (If needed)

data.description:
Log transforms your Pebble into a powerful data collection tool that's ready to capture information wherever you go.  Whether you want to track smartstrap output (e.g. GPS or heart rate), built-in sensor data (compass, accelerometer), or your own custom-defined events and properties, Log allows you to collect the data that's important to you, and easily visualize the results.

*** OPEN BETA ***
This version of Log features limited functionality.  We need your help validating the underlying technology - give it a download, press some buttons, look at the graphs (currently via config) and let us know what you think!  The current build allows you to manually track your charging habits - and at present all user data is aggregated.  If you like the idea, let us know, and we may invite you to test smartstrap, health, voice, and other custom functionality! :)

Thank you for your help, and feel free to get in touch with any questions, feedback, or suggestions! :)

latest_release.release_notes: Added status bar, compass and accelerometer measurement! :)

data.title: Log - Data Collection and Visualization (BETA)

data.description:
Monitor your MyFitnessPal food diary right from your Pebble. Shows you progress of your daily totals compared to your goal for the day. Shows Calories and the first three other nutrients tracked in your diary settings. Buttons move backward and forward through the calendar so you can compare previous days.

Food diary must be set to public for Pebble to gain access to your information. No password is required.

If you like the app, please heart it in the app store. If you don't like it or would like to see additional features, please let me know and I will see what I can do. Remember, I can only read from your public diary. I cannot write to it.

We are not affiliated with or endorsed by MyFitnessPal or Under Armour.

latest_release.release_notes: Update to accommodate changes to MyFitnessPal's public diary page.

changelog.release_notes: Compatibility update for whatever the future holds! Now contacts a website to get updates for which calendar to check. In theory, this will allow the app to function as long as I have the domain and update that every year.
Compatibility update for the 2017-2018 school year! Happy new year of school and may you receive all the 7s possible.
Your first friend's name should now no longer change to "Somebody" when you're looking at it on the configuration page. Plus, huge improvements to the configuration page - it's no longer an eyesore!
Minor text and icon fixes.
Fixed icons for classes not appearing in the app! They're back. :)
This minor update fixes an issue where the configuration page would not load for new users.
Fixed timeline pins. It broke last update. Sorry!

It just snowed for the first time in Ottawa a few days ago. Winter is coming. Unlike bears, that hibernate, this app now has gained the capability to wake up just in time for winter.

That means that in settings, there's now an option to make the app wake up every day at 12AM, to automatically fetch the date and push timeline pins. It automatically closes itself 15 seconds too! :) So instead of having to open the app every morning to have timeline pins, it will automatically do that!

NOTE: This feature is disabled by default. Because of how Pebble.js apps work, this may fail if the watch isn't connected to your phone. In these cases, it will show the "Your watch is disconnected" message, and will not quit itself. If you see this message frequently, best to disable this option. :(

Happy Canadian Thanksgiving (even though it was three days ago)!

This release adds timeline support for classes. As long as the app is opened at least once a day, pins will be pushed to your timeline. This means that classes can now be seen on top of the watchface (if you have a Time series or higher), or with one push of the down button!

The icon for Earth and Space Sciences has been changed to a rocket. Those are more interesting than stars.

The app has also been updated to work for the 2016-2017 school year. School is starting soon for Colonel By, and I had to make sure that my app would work.

Thanks for downloading, and if you think this app is nice, give it a heart on the app store. It would make my day!
Fixed the icon for Earth and Space Sciences.

Fixed an issue where when offline, would display the fourth period instead of the first.
Also fixes an issue if the first launch is offline and it's summer - it no longer displays an error!
Fixed the icon for physics, so it no longer displays a monitor.
View what day it is at Colonel By and what classes you have right on your wrist. See your schedule, course code, teacher, and room with two clicks of a button. Never forget what class you have again!

data.description:
NEVER FORGET WHAT CLASS IT IS!

With CB Schedule, you'll be able to: 

- See the current day and what your next class is with a few clicks of a button!
- See your entire schedule, course codes, teacher, and room number with just another few clicks. (Plus, icons for almost every class!)
- Add your friends' schedules so they don't get lost either.
- See your schedule on the Timeline, so you don't even need to open the app. Plus, with Timeline Quick View, you'll be able to see your next class directly on your watchface.
- A cow picture, if you figure out how to see the credits.

Requires setup with Pebble app.

I am not affiliated with EUFA in any way, and therefore this app is unofficial.
